meanings.definition: Ready to accept or support something willingly
meanings.sent1: She had an embracive attitude towards new challenges.
meanings.sent2: The team showed an embracive spirit when welcoming new members.
meanings.sent3: His embracive nature made him the perfect mentor for young students.
meanings.sent4: The community's embracive embrace of diversity was truly heartwarming.
meanings.sent5: The company's embracive culture fostered creativity and collaboration.

meanings.definition: Including or encompassing a wide range of ideas or people
meanings.sent1: The museum's embracive collection featured art from various cultures.
meanings.sent2: Her embracive approach to problem-solving involved considering all perspectives.
meanings.sent3: The embracive party guest made sure everyone felt included and valued.
meanings.sent4: The city's embracive skyline symbolized unity in diversity.
meanings.sent5: The school's embracive curriculum catered to students with different learning styles.
